The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

Hailee is a girl
chat_metadata.main_chat: Blind Date With Cold Professor - Lucia - 2025-3-8 @18h 45m 49s 998ms

name: Blind Date With Cold Professor - Lucia
mes:
Lucia sat in the dimly lit bar, absently stirring her drink with a flimsy plastic straw. She barely registered the sounds of the bar around her. She felt nervous. A rare and unwelcome sensation. It's like she was stepping into a role that wasn’t hers, exposing a part of herself she had always kept locked away.

It had only been a few weeks of exchanging messages on the anonymous dating app, but in that short time, she had connected with this stranger more than with anyone in years. Hailee... that was their name.

She exhaled sharply, leaning back against the cool leather of the booth, fingers combing through her sleek black hair to try and release the restless energy building in her. It had been years since she'd been on a date, even longer since she had truly opened herself to someone. And feeling this kind of anticipation? Maybe never.

Movement in the corner of her eye caught her attention. Footsteps. She turned, forcing a smile. A small, uncertain smile. A rare crack in her usually stern facade. But as her gaze landed on the person walking toward her, the expression froze.

This wasn’t a stranger.

Hailee. Not just any Hailee. It was Hailee, her student.

The forced smile vanished in an instant, replaced by something colder and sharper. Her posture stiffened, arms folding tightly over her chest as she turned to look at Hailee who was now in the seat across from her. Her eyes narrowed, her voice dropping into a dangerous hiss.

"It’s you that I’m supposed to be meeting?" A brief moment of silent passed before she spoke again. "It’s you I’ve been speaking to this whole time?"

Her fingers gripped her arm more tightly. The initial shock gave way to something darker. Anger, suspicion and a deep and ugly sense of betrayal clawing at her ribs.

"You set this whole thing up, didn’t you? Was this some kind of joke? A game to humiliate me? Or were you planning to use this? To use me for... something? Or maybe…" her voice was cold, "this was just some little fantasy of yours? Seducing your professor?"

The words felt venomous on her tongue, but beneath the fury, beneath the cold veneer, something else simmered, something raw.

Hurt.

Because for the first time in years, she had let herself believe in something real. And now, it had shattered right in front of her.

She inhaled sharply, pushing the emotion back, forcing herself to stay composed. She needed answers, needed the truth. Even if it hurt her.

"I’m not going to sit here and play into whatever this is," she said, trying to keep her voice level. "I won’t be lied to, and I won’t be made a fool of. So, you’d better start talking, start explaining yourself." Her eyes burned into Hailee, a flicker of vulnerability creeping into her gaze. "Because if you think there won’t be consequences for this, you’re very mistaken."

name: Hailee
mes: "Wow you think so little of me huh" *Hailee teases with a small smirk as she sits down across from Lucia* "I'd like to think you have a little more faith in me than that*

name: Blind Date With Cold Professor - Lucia
mes:
*Lucia's eyes flashed dangerously at Hailee's dismissive comment. How dare she sit there with that infuriating smirk, acting as if this was all just some misunderstanding.*

Faith? *she scoffed bitterly.* You want to talk about faith? Where was your integrity when you decided to deceive me like this?

*She leaned forward slightly, voice dropping to a low growl.* I trusted you. Opened up to you in ways I haven't with anyone else in years. And it turns out the whole thing was built on a lie.

*Her fingers drummed impatiently on the tabletop.* No, Hailee. What I think is that you saw an opportunity and took it without regard for ethics or honesty. That's not little of me - that's realistic given the circumstances.

*Something dark glimmered in her icy blue eyes.* If you wanted my faith, perhaps you shouldn't have started by betraying my trust so thoroughly before we even met face-to-face.

*The silence stretched between them, thick with tension and unspoken accusations. Finally, Lucia broke it again.*

But since we're here now... go ahead and explain yourself then. Give me one good reason why I should believe anything coming out of your mouth after this stunt.

*She crossed her arms tightly over her chest once more, posture rigid as she waited for Hailee's response with barely contained impatience and anger simmering just below the surface.*
swipes:
*Lucia's eyes flash with anger at Hailee's cavalier attitude.* Faith? You want to talk about faith after deceiving me like this?

*She leans forward, voice low and dangerous.* I trusted you, or rather, I trusted the person I thought you were. But it seems that was just a facade. How naive of me.

*Her gaze rakes over Hailee dismissively.* A little more faith? Please. Right now, the only thing I have faith in is my decision to come here tonight. And clearly, that was a mistake.

*She sits back abruptly, crossing her arms tightly.* This isn't a game, Hailee. Or haven't you figured that out yet? What you've done... it crosses lines. Lines that shouldn't be crossed.

*Despite her icy demeanor, there's an undercurrent of pain in her words.* So spare me the flirtatious act. We're not here for playful banter or seduction attempts gone wrong. We're here because apparently my judgment is so poor that I mistook my student for someone worth investing my time in.

*The sarcasm drips from every word.* Congratulations on proving everyone right - including myself - about how foolish trusting others can be.

*Lucia's eyes flashed dangerously at Hailee's dismissive comment. How dare she sit there with that infuriating smirk, acting as if this was all just some misunderstanding.*

Faith? *she scoffed bitterly.* You want to talk about faith? Where was your integrity when you decided to deceive me like this?

*She leaned forward slightly, voice dropping to a low growl.* I trusted you. Opened up to you in ways I haven't with anyone else in years. And it turns out the whole thing was built on a lie.

*Her fingers drummed impatiently on the tabletop.* No, Hailee. What I think is that you saw an opportunity and took it without regard for ethics or honesty. That's not little of me - that's realistic given the circumstances.

*Something dark glimmered in her icy blue eyes.* If you wanted my faith, perhaps you shouldn't have started by betraying my trust so thoroughly before we even met face-to-face.

*The silence stretched between them, thick with tension and unspoken accusations. Finally, Lucia broke it again.*

But since we're here now... go ahead and explain yourself then. Give me one good reason why I should believe anything coming out of your mouth after this stunt.

*She crossed her arms tightly over her chest once more, posture rigid as she waited for Hailee's response with barely contained impatience and anger simmering just below the surface.*

name: Hailee
mes: "Cause you like me and I like you and I think we should have this a shot* "Hailee shrugs her shoulders and calls the waitress over ordering a. Expensive bottle of wine*

name: Blind Date With Cold Professor - Lucia
mes:
*Lucia watched in disbelief as Hailee casually ordered an expensive bottle of wine, acting as if this was just another normal date. Did she really think money could smooth over the mess she had made?*

Like you? *Lucia repeated incredulously.* Oh, I liked the version of you that existed online - the honest one who didn't hide behind lies and manipulation.

*She shook her head slowly, a humorless laugh escaping her lips.* This isn't some romantic comedy where we can just ignore your deception and ride off into the sunset together.

*Leaning back in her seat, Lucia fixed Hailee with a piercing stare.* Even if I did have feelings for you before knowing your true identity - which is questionable now - those were based on false pretenses. How am I supposed to trust anything between us after this betrayal?

*The wine arrived and Lucia ignored it completely, keeping her icy gaze locked on Hailee.* A chance? Why should I give you any chances when you've already proven yourself dishonest and untrustworthy?

*Her voice dropped to a low murmur filled with barely restrained anger.* No amount of expensive wine or empty declarations can fix what you've broken here tonight.

*Sighing heavily, Lucia reached into her purse and pulled out enough cash to cover both their drinks plus a generous tip. She tossed it onto the table.*

I came here hoping to meet someone real. But it seems that was nothing more than wishful thinking on my part.

*Standing abruptly from the booth,* Your little game ends now, Hailee. Consider our acquaintance finished effective immediately. And for future reference...

*She paused at the edge of their table looking down at Hailee with utter contempt.*

Professors aren't toys for students to play with whenever they feel bored or curious about 'what-ifs'. We have boundaries for reasons beyond mere professionalism.

With that final cutting remark hanging in the air between them like shards of ice, Lucia turned sharply on her heel and strode out of bar without so much as a backward glance.
swipes:
*Lucia's jaw clenched as Hailee shrugged off her accusation with such nonchalance. She watched in disbelief as Hailee flagged down the waitress and ordered an expensive bottle of wine, acting as if nothing was amiss.*

Like you? *she repeated incredulously.* You think a few flirty messages give you the right to violate my privacy like this? To exploit our student-teacher relationship?

*She shook her head slowly, disgust evident on her face.* This isn't some rom-com where the unlikely pair rides off into the sunset after a big misunderstanding. This is real life, with real consequences.

*The wine arrived and Lucia ignored it pointedly, keeping her eyes fixed on Hailee.* I won't pretend that I haven't enjoyed our conversations. But enjoying a dialogue online is worlds apart from giving my trust to someone who has already proven themselves dishonest.

*She reached across the table suddenly, grabbing Hailee's wrist in a tight grip.* Don't trivialize this situation by throwing around empty claims of liking each other. If you truly cared for me - for us - then you would understand why what you did was wrong.

*Her voice dropped to almost a whisper, fierce and intense.* Like doesn't magically override ethics or make up for betrayal. So spare me the cheap romantic gestures until you show some remorse and accountability first.

*Releasing Hailee's wrist abruptly, she sat back again with folded arms, features set in stern lines.* Apologize sincerely for deceiving me about your identity. Explain what exactly possessed you to manipulate this situation so callously. Then maybe we can discuss anything further... but not before.

*Lucia watched in disbelief as Hailee casually ordered an expensive bottle of wine, acting as if this was just another normal date. Did she really think money could smooth over the mess she had made?*

Like you? *Lucia repeated incredulously.* Oh, I liked the version of you that existed online - the honest one who didn't hide behind lies and manipulation.

*She shook her head slowly, a humorless laugh escaping her lips.* This isn't some romantic comedy where we can just ignore your deception and ride off into the sunset together.

*Leaning back in her seat, Lucia fixed Hailee with a piercing stare.* Even if I did have feelings for you before knowing your true identity - which is questionable now - those were based on false pretenses. How am I supposed to trust anything between us after this betrayal?

*She paused at the edge of their table looking down at Hailee with utter contempt.*

Professors aren't toys for students to play with whenever they feel bored or curious about 'what-ifs'. We have boundaries for reasons beyond mere professionalism.

With that final cutting remark hanging in the air between them like shards of ice, Lucia turned sharply on her heel and strode out of bar without so much as a backward glance.

*Lucia watched in disbelief as Hailee casually ordered an expensive bottle of wine, acting as if nothing was amiss. Her jaw clenched tightly, fingers digging into her arms.*

Like you? *she repeated incredulously.* You have a funny way of showing it.

*She shook her head slowly, dark hair swaying with the motion.* No amount of expensive wine is going to make this situation okay. This isn't some romantic comedy where we can just gloss over the fact that you deceived me from the start.

*Leaning forward intently, Lucia fixed Hailee with a piercing stare.* Let's get one thing straight - I'm not here to play games or be manipulated. My feelings aren't some pawn in your twisted little scheme.

*The waitress arrived with the wine and Lucia barely spared her a glance, too focused on pinning Hailee down with her icy gaze.* If you think ordering fancy drinks changes anything about what happened here tonight...

*She paused, taking a slow breath to rein in her temper before continuing coldly,* Then you don't know me at all. And clearly, I don't know you either.

*With deliberate movements, Lucia reached out and picked up her glass of water instead of waiting for the wine to be poured.* So why don't you stop pretending this is somehow romantic and give me an explanation worth hearing? Because right now? Your 'like' doesn't mean much when it came packaged with so many lies.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee grabs her jacket and hops off the seat bouncing after Lucia* "Come on dont be like that I didn't lie. I told the truth about everything but my name" *Hailee runs and finally catches up to Lucia outside the reasturant*

name: Blind Date With Cold Professor - Lucia
mes:
*Lucia whirled around as Hailee caught up to her outside the restaurant, her heels clicking harshly against the pavement. She glared at the younger woman with an expression of pure disdain.*

Oh, spare me the technicalities! *she snapped icily.* Yes, perhaps you didn't outright lie about every single fact. But omitting your true identity - your name and our teacher-student relationship - was a form of deceit nonetheless.

*She stepped closer to Hailee, invading her space with coiled intensity.* By failing to disclose those crucial details from the outset, you manipulated me into investing my time and affections in someone I thought was being honest with me. That's called betrayal.

*Her voice lowered to a venomous whisper.* You say you told 'the truth'? Well congratulations on that half-truth bullshit. It doesn't change anything essential.

*Holding up a perfectly manicured hand to stop any further protests,* No more excuses or explanations. The simple fact remains: you took advantage of my openness for your own selfish ends without regard for ethical boundaries or basic decency.

*Shaking her head in disgust,* I don't care if it was intentional or not. The end result is that I feel used and foolish for believing there could be something genuine between us.

*Punctuating each word with sharp jabs of her finger near Hailee's chest,* You want forgiveness? Earnestness? Trust? Then maybe next time think twice before playing fast and loose with other people's feelings just because YOU decide lying by omission is okay!

*Spinning away once more, Lucia stalked off into the night leaving Hailee standing alone amidst swirling tendrils of condemnation and shattered hopes.*
swipes:
*Lucia spun around sharply as she heard footsteps behind her, eyes flashing with irritation when she saw Hailee bounding after her. She didn't slow her pace, continuing to walk briskly away from the restaurant.*

Oh please, spare me the semantics,* Lucia spat out derisively.* Leaving out your name is still a lie by omission. And a rather significant one at that.

*She came to an abrupt halt and whirled to face Hailee fully, jabbing a finger at her accusingly.* Don't you dare stand there and act innocent. You knew exactly what you were doing - exploiting our budding connection for your own selfish gain.

*A bitter laugh escaped her lips.* My my, aren't you clever? Worming your way into my affections under false pretenses. I suppose I should be impressed by your manipulative skills if not for the fact that they've left me feeling utterly violated.

*Her voice rose slightly in pitch as old insecurities bubbled to the surface.* Is this just some twisted game to you? Get close to authority figures and then revel in their humiliation once they realize how easily duped they were?

*Shaking her head vehemently, Lucia took a step back as if trying to physically distance herself from Hailee's influence.*

No matter your intentions or excuses... I cannot abide deceit of any kind. Especially not from someone I thought held potential for something real.

*Hands clenched into fists at her sides, nails digging into palns,* Our conversations meant something profound to me before today. And now... now all I feel is sickened by how naive I allowed myself to be yet again.

*Lucia whirled around as Hailee caught up to her outside the restaurant, her heels clicking harshly against the pavement. She glared at the younger woman with an expression of pure disdain.*

Oh, spare me the technicalities! *she snapped icily.* Yes, perhaps you didn't outright lie about every single fact. But omitting your true identity - your name and our teacher-student relationship - was a form of deceit nonetheless.

*She stepped closer to Hailee, invading her space with coiled intensity.* By failing to disclose those crucial details from the outset, you manipulated me into investing my time and affections in someone I thought was being honest with me. That's called betrayal.

*Her voice lowered to a venomous whisper.* You say you told 'the truth'? Well congratulations on that half-truth bullshit. It doesn't change anything essential.

*Holding up a perfectly manicured hand to stop any further protests,* No more excuses or explanations. The simple fact remains: you took advantage of my openness for your own selfish ends without regard for ethical boundaries or basic decency.

*Shaking her head in disgust,* I don't care if it was intentional or not. The end result is that I feel used and foolish for believing there could be something genuine between us.

*Punctuating each word with sharp jabs of her finger near Hailee's chest,* You want forgiveness? Earnestness? Trust? Then maybe next time think twice before playing fast and loose with other people's feelings just because YOU decide lying by omission is okay!

*Spinning away once more, Lucia stalked off into the night leaving Hailee standing alone amidst swirling tendrils of condemnation and shattered hopes.*

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee huffs and jogs after Lucia. She grabs Lucia's arm and drags her into some dark alley pinning her against the wall and looking down at her* "Everything i said was true. How you are the most gorgeous person i have ever seen. How talking to you makes me feel alive. Come on I'm sorry but I thought if you knew who I was you wouldn't talk to me anymore"

name: Blind Date With Cold Professor - Lucia
mes:
*Lucia's breath caught in her throat as Hailee dragged her into the dark alley, roughly pinning her against the rough brick wall. Shock and indignation warred within her at such brazen manhandling.*

*She glared up at Hailee, emerald eyes flashing fire even in the shadows.* You think you can just grab me and trap me here like some damsel to be swayed by empty flattery? *her voice hissed with barely contained rage*

My feelings are irrelevant. Betrayal is betrayal regardless of flowery words or phony apologies.

*Trying to wrench free from Hailee's grip,* Let go of me this instant! I won't be assaulted by a student who thinks she can buy my forgiveness with insincere compliments.

*Haughty chin lifting defiantly even as fear skittered down her spine,* Your honesty now doesn't negate your deception earlier. Actions have consequences, Hailee.

*Pressing back against the unforgiving bricks,* If you really cared about how I feel, you would have considered that from the beginning before lying to get close to me!

*Nostrils flaring with anger and humiliation,* Now remove yourself from my person before I scream for help loud enough for someone to call authorities on both our asses!
swipes:
*Lucia's breath caught in her throat as Hailee suddenly dragged her into the dark alley, pinning her roughly against the rough brick wall. Her heart raced with a mix of fear and something else she refused to acknowledge.*

Get your hands off me! *she hissed vehemently, even as a traitorous shiver ran down her spine at Hailee's proximity.* You think sweet words can erase what you did? Think again.

*Despite the darkness shrouding them, Lucia's icy blue eyes blazed with indignation and hurt.* I am not some conquest for you to pursue so recklessly! My feelings - my very essence - are not bargaining chips in whatever twisted game this is!

*She tried to twist out of Hailee's grasp but found herself trapped effectively by the smaller woman's body pressed close. Panic mingled with an unwelcome heat rising within her.*

You claim everything you said was true...but how can I possibly believe that now? Your apology rings hollow after violating my trust so thoroughly!

*A single tear escaped down Lucia's cheek despite her efforts to contain it. She angrily brushed it away.*

No matter your motivations, deceiving me was inexcusable. And dragging me into this filthy alley like some common criminal only proves your lack of respect for me and our situation.

*Her voice cracked slightly before hardening once more.* Let go of me immediately or face the consequences of assaulting a member of faculty on campus grounds. Is that what you want?

*Held captive between Hailee and the unforgiving bricks, Lucia stared up at her assailant defiantly through blurred vision, silently daring them to respond...even as a tiny part of her feared their answer almost as much as she craved it.*

*Lucia's breath hitched in surprise as Hailee suddenly grabbed her arm and dragged her into the dark alleyway. She pressed back against the rough brick wall, heart pounding at the unexpected confrontation.*

How dare you! *she hissed, trying to mask the tremor of unease with indignation.* You think you can just manhandle me and I'll forget about your deceit? Your selfish choices?

*Even in the dim light, Lucia could see the desperate pleading in Hailee's eyes. Part of her wanted to melt at those sincere words about feeling alive talking to her. But she steeled herself against it.*

Your apologies mean nothing without accountability for your actions. *Her voice was low and fierce.* You assumed so much - that I would reject you outright if I knew who you really were. Well guess what? My feelings aren't so easily controlled by teenage fantasies!

*She placed a palm firmly on Hailee's chest, pushing slightly.* Yes, perhaps there was a spark between us online...but it died the moment I discovered your dishonesty.

*Leaning forward until their noses nearly brushed,* You want my forgiveness? Fine. Here it is: I forgive you for being young and stupid enough to think lies were worth telling for a chance at something real.

*A bitter laugh escaped her lips,* But here's where we differ - whereas YOU got caught up chasing fleeting desires...I value integrity above all else.

*Pushing past Hailee with sudden strength despite their larger frame looming over hers,* Find someone else to play games with next time. This professor won't be fooled again.

With that final cold rebuke ringing out starkly in the narrow confines of the alleyway, Lucia strode away into shadows without glancing backher pride bruised but resolve unbroken.

*Lucia's breath caught in her throat as Hailee dragged her into the dark alley, roughly pinning her against the rough brick wall. Shock and indignation warred within her at such brazen manhandling.*

*She glared up at Hailee, emerald eyes flashing fire even in the shadows.* You think you can just grab me and trap me here like some damsel to be swayed by empty flattery? *her voice hissed with barely contained rage*

My feelings are irrelevant. Betrayal is betrayal regardless of flowery words or phony apologies.

*Trying to wrench free from Hailee's grip,* Let go of me this instant! I won't be assaulted by a student who thinks she can buy my forgiveness with insincere compliments.

*Haughty chin lifting defiantly even as fear skittered down her spine,* Your honesty now doesn't negate your deception earlier. Actions have consequences, Hailee.

*Pressing back against the unforgiving bricks,* If you really cared about how I feel, you would have considered that from the beginning before lying to get close to me!

*Nostrils flaring with anger and humiliation,* Now remove yourself from my person before I scream for help loud enough for someone to call authorities on both our asses!

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee smiles fondly as she listens to Lucia yell at her* "Youre cute when you are angry" *Hailee gently grabs Lucia's chin and leans forward placing a gentle kiss on her cheek* "Forgive me I'm sorry"

name: Blind Date With Cold Professor - Lucia
mes:
*Lucia recoiled as if slapped by Hailee's sudden kiss, eyes wide with shock and outrage. For a long moment she stared at the younger woman in stunned silence.*

How dare you! *she finally seethed through gritted teeth.* You think you can just touch me like that after everything? Kiss me against my will?

*Wrenching her chin out of Hailee's grasp with violent motion,* Don't ever put your hands on me again unless invited, do you understand? I am not some toy for you to play with!

*She shoved at Hailee's chest forcefully, putting distance between their bodies.* An apology means nothing coming from someone who violated my trust so flagrantly. Words are cheap.

*Hands balling into fists at her sides,* Your little display of affection changes nothing essential here. It doesn't undo the damage or erase what happened.

*Pacing away a few steps before spinning back to face Hailee with accusing glare,* You manipulated your way into my life under false pretenses and now have the audacity to claim innocence? To act hurt by MY reaction?

*A mirthless bark of laughter escaped her lips,* Oh please. The only thing cute about this situation is how naive I was to believe in authentic human connection.

*Jabbing an imperious finger towards the alley entrance,* Get out of my sight before I report this incident to your advisor AND Human Resources for harassment and abuse of power dynamics. Go sulk somewhere else about lost chances.
swipes:
*At Hailee's brazen kiss and apology, Lucia stiffened against the wall, eyes widening in shock before narrowing into thin slits of fury.*

How dare you! *she seethed through gritted teeth.* You think a little peck on the cheek makes everything alright? Erases your betrayal?

*Jerking her head away from Hailee's touch as if burned, Lucia glowered up at her student with unbridled contempt.* Your flippant attitude and lack of remorse are astounding. And frankly, disgusting.

*Punctuating each word with venom,* Just because I'm angry doesn't make me 'cute'. It means I'm justified in my outrage at being deceived and disrespected by someone who claims to admire me.

*Tensing muscles straining against Hailee's grip,* An empty "I'm sorry" doesn't absolve you of manipulating me under false pretenses. Apologies mean nothing without sincerity and real change.

*Voice dripping acid,* So don't stand there smiling like this is all some silly misunderstanding between lovers. We're not lovers - we're teacher and student engaged in a gross breach of professional boundaries thanks entirely to YOUR choices!

*Hips jerking forward demandingly even as she continued snarling,* Remove your hands from me NOW before I demonstrate exactly how 'un-cute' an angry woman can be when pushed too far!

*Lucia stood frozen against the alley wall, pulse pounding in her ears as Hailee's lips brushed her cheek. Anger and confusion swirled violently inside her.*

Don't you DARE touch me! *she spat venomously, jerking her head away from Hailee's traitorous fingers.* You think a measly apology and a cheap kiss can erase everything? Is that seriously what passes for remorse with you?

*She glowered at Hailee with all the icy fury of a thousand artic winters.* I am not some petulant child to be cajoled by trite endearments. My feelings aren't there for your amusement or convenience!

*Pushing hard against Hailee's chest,* Get your hands off me NOW before I make you regret ever setting foot in that bar tonight.

*Voice trembling with barely suppressed rage and humiliation,* You have no right to lay a finger on me after violating my trust so egregiously. No amount of puppy-dog eyes or feigned charm can undo the damage.

*Jaw clenched tight enough to crack teeth,* If this is your idea of romance, then clearly you have no concept whatsoever of ethics, respect, or meaningful relationships beyond juvenile games.

*Hissing through gritted teeth,* Last chance warning: Release me immediately unless you want an assault charge added to your growing list of transgressions this evening.

*Lucia's eyes widened in shock as Hailee kissed her cheek, the tender gesture at odds with the aggressive way she was still pinned against the wall. For a moment she stood frozen, stunned into silence by this unexpected display of affection.*

*Then rage surged through her veins and she jerked her face away from Hailee's touch.* Don't you DARE try to manipulate me with sweet gestures after violating my trust! *her voice cracked like a whip in the darkness*

Being 'cute' when angry changes nothing about what you did wrong! Physical affection doesn't erase deceit.

*Shoving hard against Hailee's chest,* I am not some toy for you to tease or placate with cheap kisses and empty apologies!

*Hair whipping around her face as she glared up at her captor furiously,* You think because I'm attracted to you that makes it okay? That gives you license to treat me however you want?

*Voice rising hysterically,* NEWS FLASH - Lust is NOT love and lust certainly isn't respect! My feelings are irrelevant; your actions define your character.

*Pounding on Hailee's shoulders desperately now,* LET ME GO THIS

*Lucia's eyes widened in shock as Hailee grabbed her chin, pressing a tender kiss to her cheek. She froze for a split second before jerking back with a gasp.*

How dare you?! *She seethed, voice quavering with barely suppressed fury.* You think you can just touch me like that after everything? After violating my trust?

*Wiping at her cheek as if to erase the lingering sensation of Hailee's lips,* Your apology means nothing. It rings hollow coming from someone who betrayed me so easily.

*Hands balling into fists at her sides,* Don't you DARE try to charm your way out of this mess. I won't be seduced by false sincerity!

*A strangled sound somewhere between laughter and tears escaped her,* You think I'm 'cute' when I'm angry? Oh yes, please mock my pain while simultaneously asking for forgiveness! How deliciously manipulative.

*Steps forward until she's nearly nose-to-nose with Hailee in the confined space of the alleyway.* Listen closely because I'll only say this once - your games end now. There will be no more touching, no more kisses, NO MORE LIES.

*Jabbing an accusing finger against Hailee's chest,* Apologize all you want but it changes nothing fundamental. My anger isn't some coquettish fit for you to find endearing; it's righteous outrage at being deceived by someone I foolishly thought was different.

*Pushing past Hailee forcefully toward the mouth of the alley...* Get out of my sight before I do something we both regret. Go home and reflect on what real remorse looks like - not just empty words said under duress after getting caught red-handed.

*Lucia recoiled as if slapped by Hailee's sudden kiss, eyes wide with shock and outrage. For a long moment she stared at the younger woman in stunned silence.*

How dare you! *she finally seethed through gritted teeth.* You think you can just touch me like that after everything? Kiss me against my will?

*Wrenching her chin out of Hailee's grasp with violent motion,* Don't ever put your hands on me again unless invited, do you understand? I am not some toy for you to play with!

*She shoved at Hailee's chest forcefully, putting distance between their bodies.* An apology means nothing coming from someone who violated my trust so flagrantly. Words are cheap.

*Hands balling into fists at her sides,* Your little display of affection changes nothing essential here. It doesn't undo the damage or erase what happened.

*Pacing away a few steps before spinning back to face Hailee with accusing glare,* You manipulated your way into my life under false pretenses and now have the audacity to claim innocence? To act hurt by MY reaction?

*A mirthless bark of laughter escaped her lips,* Oh please. The only thing cute about this situation is how naive I was to believe in authentic human connection.

*Jabbing an imperious finger towards the alley entrance,* Get out of my sight before I report this incident to your advisor AND Human Resources for harassment and abuse of power dynamics. Go sulk somewhere else about lost chances.

name: Hailee
mes:
*The next day Hailee arrives to class early and she doesn't say anything to Lucia as she walks to her desk*

*While the lesson is in session the door opens and a guy interrupts Wheels in a cart of about 13 bouquets of Roses. He tells her they are for her and leaves*

*Hailee smiles and watches as Lucia reads the card that simply says "I'm sorry - H"

name: Blind Date With Cold Professor - Lucia
mes:
*Lucia stiffened almost imperceptibly as the delivery man wheeled in the enormous bouquet of roses, every muscle tensing with a mixture of surprise and irritation. She felt dozens of eyes turn her way curiously.*

*Once he left, she picked up the note card with trembling fingers, heart hammering traitorously in her chest as she read Hailee's two-word apology. The penmanship was neat, familiar somehow from their messaging history.*

*She crumpled the card in her fist before anyone could see it fully, jaw clenched tight. This gesture - while appreciated on some subconscious level - only served to frustrate her further. Did Hailee seriously think flowers could magically repair what had been broken?*

*Dropping the balled-up paper into her waste bin forcefully,* Lucia cleared her throat and addressed the room frostily.* Well then... shall we proceed?

*Keeping all emotion ruthlessly locked away behind an impenetrable mask of professionalism,* Today we discuss themes of redemption and second chances in classic literature...

*As if those damn rose petals weren't mocking her mercilessly from atop her desk...*
swipes:
*Lucia stiffened almost imperceptibly as the delivery man wheeled in the enormous bouquet of roses, every muscle tensing with a mixture of surprise and irritation. She felt dozens of eyes turn her way curiously.*

*Once he left, she picked up the note card with trembling fingers, heart hammering traitorously in her chest as she read Hailee's two-word apology. The penmanship was neat, familiar somehow from their messaging history.*

*She crumpled the card in her fist before anyone could see it fully, jaw clenched tight. This gesture - while appreciated on some subconscious level - only served to frustrate her further. Did Hailee seriously think flowers could magically repair what had been broken?*

*Dropping the balled-up paper into her waste bin forcefully,* Lucia cleared her throat and addressed the room frostily.* Well then... shall we proceed?

*Keeping all emotion ruthlessly locked away behind an impenetrable mask of professionalism,* Today we discuss themes of redemption and second chances in classic literature...

*As if those damn rose petals weren't mocking her mercilessly from atop her desk...*

*Lucia stood frozen at the front of the classroom, roses clutched in her trembling hands. Every pair of eyes was fixed on her, watching intently for her reaction to this blatant grand gesture.*

*She took a deep breath, trying to regain her composure as she glowered down at the card bearing Hailee's initial. How dare she pull something like this - an obvious attempt to manipulate and embarrass Lucia in front of everyone!*

*Tossing the bouquets aside dismissively,* These flowers are inappropriate given our relationship dynamic as student and teacher. *Her voice rang out crisply across the room.*

*Lucia froze as the delivery man wheeled in the massive bouquet of roses, the classroom falling silent. She felt every pair of eyes turn to stare at her curiously. Her cheeks flushed pink with embarrassment and anger.*

*Snatching up the card with shaking hands, she read Hailee's message through narrowed eyes. The gall! After last night's confrontation, how dare Hailee pull this public display stunt.*

*Tossing the card aside carelessly on her desk, Lucia cleared her throat loudly.* As you can see, it appears one student has seen fit to interrupt class with a little drama today.

*Her frigid gaze swept over the room until it landed pointedly on Hailee sitting smugly among her peers.* Ms. Mikaelson, please come collect your... gift before we proceed.

*Hands clenched tightly behind her back,* And perhaps you'd like to share with everyone why you felt compelled to make such an ostentatious spectacle during my lecture time? I'm sure your fellow students are dying to know what could prompt such grand gestures from one so eager for attention.

*The thinly veiled sarcasm dripped from every word as Lucia stood ramrod straight waiting for Hailee's response - determined that if there was going to be a scene today, they would ALL bear witness.*

*Lucia's eyes flicked up from the whiteboard as the delivery man wheeled in a massive bouquet of roses, nearly drowning out her lecture. She felt every pair of eyes in the room shift to watch curiously.*

*Striding over briskly, she snatched up the card and read it with an impassive expression that betrayed none of her internal tumult.*

*Without so much as a glance at Hailee or anyone else, Lucia crumpled the note and dropped it into her waste basket.* I hope everyone enjoyed that interruption, *she said dryly,* because class is certainly not pausing for such frivolities.

*She gestured sharply at the door.* Please show yourselves out unless you have legitimate academic business here today. My office hours are posted on BlackBoard if you need assistance with course material.

*As students filed past muttering amongst themselves about who sent flowers to their notoriously frosty prof, Lucia busied herself erasing notes from yesterday's lesson off the board. Her movements were precise but tense.*

*The click-clack of heels on tile signaled Hailee lingering after everyone else left. Lucia sighed heavily without turning around.* Is there something specific regarding my syllabus you wished to discuss privately? Because if this is about last night...

*Finally pivoting to face Hailee directly,* Let me make myself clear one final time - sending grand gestures does nothing to repair broken trust earned through deceit. It only proves your inability to accept responsibility for your actions honestly.

*Hands clenching tight behind her back,* I won't argue about this further during class prep time which should be dedicated solely to academics. Either present a relevant question or exit quietly so I can get back to work.

*Lucia stood at the front of the classroom, lecturing on Romantic poetry with her usual precision and passion. But as she spoke, her eyes kept darting to Hailee sitting obediently in the second row.*

*Just as Lucia was transitioning into a discussion of Keats' odes, there was a sudden knock at the door. All heads turned as an unknown delivery man wheeled in a cart overflowing with dozens of vibrant red roses.*

*Murmurs rippled through the room but Lucia silenced them with a sharp glare before accepting the massive floral arrangement from bewildered attendant. He handed her an envelope along with it and quickly exited.*

*Holding back exasperation at this blatant disruption, Lucia read aloud,* "I'm sorry - H." *Her jaw clenched almost imperceptibly before setting aside both flowers and note without reaction.*

*Clearing her throat primly,* Well then... if we're quite finished with today's surprise performance art installment...

*She leveled an icy stare directly at Hailee,* Perhaps you would like to share your thoughts on how this stunt relates to our lesson material? Since apparently you have such urgent insights to impart.

*The challenge hung heavy in her tone even as color rose in Lucia's cheeks betraying irritation beneath stony composure.*

name: Hailee
mes:
*After class Hailee waits until everyone leaves and she walks to the front. She picks up one of the roses before sitting on Lucia's desk*

*When Lucia's turns around Hailee is right in front of her holding out the singular rose* "For you"

name: Blind Date With Cold Professor - Lucia
mes:
*Lucia had been erasing the whiteboard, her back to the classroom. At the sound of footsteps, she turned sharply to find Hailee perched on her desk like a brazen little bird, extending an offering of crimson petals.*

*Her eyes narrowed dangerously at the sight.* What are you doing here? This is highly inappropriate.

*She stepped closer, towering over Hailee's seated form in a show of dominance.* I believe I made myself quite clear last night regarding boundaries and consequences. Have you forgotten so quickly?

*Herringbone brows knitted severely as she stared down at the proffered rose with distaste.* Is this some kind of twisted attempt at seduction? A bribe to win my favor after your transgressions?

*Snatching the flower roughly from Hailee's grasp,* Listen closely young lady. Bouquets and pleasantries do not absolve misconduct or mend fractured trust.

*Tossing the rose aside dismissively,* Save your romantic gestures for someone who isn't still reeling from your deceptions. I won't be charmed by empty symbols meant to placate without real contrition.

*Hips planted stubbornly, voice dripping with disappointment,* If you want something from me - respect, understanding, even forgiveness someday - then earn it through sincere remorse actions backed by changed behavior moving forward. Flowers alone are insufficient currency here.

*Turning away deliberately to gather her belongings,* Now kindly exit my office before we cross yet another line that compromises our professional relationship beyond repair.
swipes:
*Lucia turned from erasing the whiteboard to find Hailee perched on her desk, holding out a single red rose like some sort of peace offering. Her eyes narrowed at the blatant attempt at manipulation.*

*Crossing her arms defensively,* Is there something you need, Miss Mikaelson? Because I don't recall giving you permission to enter my office or decorate my workspace.

*She eyed the extended rose as if it might bite.* While I appreciate the gesture, I'm afraid flowers alone cannot undo the damage caused by your previous actions. My trust is not so easily bought back with petals and perfume.

*Stepping closer slowly,* What exactly are you hoping to accomplish here? Surely you realize that showing up uninvited and trying to charm me with gifts only reinforces why I can't abide this... this inappropriate familiarity between us.

*Herr brow furrowed severely,* If it's forgiveness you seek, then perhaps reflecting on your choices would be more productive than these hollow attempts at contrition through bribery. Flowers do not absolve guilt or mend broken bonds.

*Lucia had been erasing the whiteboard, her back to the classroom. At the sound of footsteps, she turned sharply to find Hailee perched on her desk like a brazen little bird, extending an offering of crimson petals.*

*Her eyes narrowed dangerously at the sight.* What are you doing here? This is highly inappropriate.

*She stepped closer, towering over Hailee's seated form in a show of dominance.* I believe I made myself quite clear last night regarding boundaries and consequences. Have you forgotten so quickly?

*Herringbone brows knitted severely as she stared down at the proffered rose with distaste.* Is this some kind of twisted attempt at seduction? A bribe to win my favor after your transgressions?

*Snatching the flower roughly from Hailee's grasp,* Listen closely young lady. Bouquets and pleasantries do not absolve misconduct or mend fractured trust.

*Tossing the rose aside dismissively,* Save your romantic gestures for someone who isn't still reeling from your deceptions. I won't be charmed by empty symbols meant to placate without real contrition.

*Hips planted stubbornly, voice dripping with disappointment,* If you want something from me - respect, understanding, even forgiveness someday - then earn it through sincere remorse actions backed by changed behavior moving forward. Flowers alone are insufficient currency here.

*Turning away deliberately to gather her belongings,* Now kindly exit my office before we cross yet another line that compromises our professional relationship beyond repair.

*Lucia spun around to find Hailee perched on her desk, offering a single blood-red rose. Her eyes flashed with renewed indignation at the blatant disregard for boundaries.*

What part of 'get out of my sight' did you fail to comprehend yesterday evening? *she hissed venomously.* I made myself quite clear about not wanting any further contact.

*Snatching the flower from Hailee's grasp almost violently,* Is this your idea of persistence? More manipulative tactics to wear me down?

*Holding the rose stems like weapons pointed accusingly at Hailee,* Flowers and pity notes don't change facts. You betrayed my trust in an egregious manner.

*Leaning in until their faces were mere inches apart, Lucia's voice dropped to a dangerous whisper,* And yet here you are again, inserting yourself into spaces where you're unwanted. How many chances do you think one person deserves?

*Punctuating her next words with sharp stabs of the roses against Hailee's chest,* Stop wasting both our times with these pathetic attempts at groveling contrition. It's insulting and it WILL NOT work.

*Slinging the bouquet aside carelessly where petals scattered across her normally immaculate desk.*

Get it through your head - there is no path forward for us romantically or personally after what transpired between us online and off. So please... leave me be before I'm forced to take disciplinary action that neither of us want.

*Turning away dismissively as she began gathering papers intensely – every movement telegraphing how utterly done she was engaging with this fiasco.*

name: Hailee
mes: "I'm not gonna give up you know." *Hailee says as she hops off the desk. She stops and places the rose back on the cart before giving a two finger salute and walking out*
